page.title: 16 Enville Hall Estates.
page.content: Acreage-HeronsGate farm 87 acres(60 in our area).Compton Hall 127 acres.Union Hall 350.Potters Cross 31.Water-see page 17.Clay side fault-oak,ash,syc- amore,beech,Sandyside-birch,bracken, conifers.Trees felled in wartime & some destroyed by fire but replanted since. Soil type dictates usage.Clay-dairy, sandy-arable.Glebeland-a section of land rented from church.Hedges-taken down for ease of machinery now not all- owed without permission because of game & drainage problems.Hedges act as m-way for wild animals.Game-pheasants,partri- dges.Visitors from Germany,France, America & Italy come to shoot.Vermin- rabbits,crows,pigeons,rooks,rodents, weasels-aim to control & preserve. Stately Homes-Brindley Hall,Compton Hall(in the Domesday Book).All farm buildings-estate.1300 Grey family owned estates(see New Victoria History).
